alert.note: Alert for Allegany; Cattaraugus; Cayuga; Livingston; Monroe; Ontario; Wayne; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 8:21AM EST until February 19 at 9:15AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Buffalo has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Wayne County in western New York... Southeastern Wyoming County in western New York... Southeastern Cattaraugus County in western New York... Livingston County in western New York... Cayuga County in central New York... Allegany County in western New York... Southeastern Monroe County in western New York... Ontario County in western New York... * Until 915 AM EST. * At 820 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 13 miles north of Williamson to near Allegany, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in snow. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 390 between exits 4 and 12. Interstate 90 between exits 46 and 42. Interstate 86 between exits 23 and 33. Locations impacted include... Rochester, Irondequoit, Olean, Geneva, Canandaigua, Geneseo, East Rochester, Webster, Fairport and Dansville. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... There is no safe place on a highway when a snow squall hits. Visibility and traction are immediately lost in whiteout conditions, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel or safely exit the highway before the snow squall arrives.

area.areaDesc: Allegany; Cattaraugus; Cayuga; Livingston; Monroe; Ontario; Wayne; Wyoming
